definition: Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: Starting with researches of Dialect itself, the linguistic thinking of Yangxiong is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 从《方言》本身的研究入手，探讨了扬雄的语言思想。

sentences.english: Yang Xiong should not be neglected when the track of self-consciousness of literature is viewed.
sentences.chinese: 当我们审视文学自觉的轨迹之时，不应忽视扬雄。

definition: Ban Gu (32-92), Eastern Han dynasty historian, wrote the Dynastic History of Western Han 漢書|汉书
Zheng Xuan (127-200), late Han scholar
Jia Yi (200-168 BC), Chinese poet and statesman of the Western Han Dynasty
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
Wang Chong (27-97), rationalist and critical philosopher
Zuo Si (3rd century), Jin dynasty writer and poet
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
Liu Xiang (77-6 BC), Han Dynasty scholar and author
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
Grand Scribe, the title by which Sima Qian 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1] refers to himself in Records of the Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4]
Han Yu (768-824), Tang dynasty essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements
Kong Yingda (574-648), Confucian scholar
Du Fu (712-770), great Tang dynasty poet
Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
